definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: How did I manage to walk away from a Chinese tea party 853 yuan lighter?
sentences.chinese: 我如何管理自己步行一中茶話會八五三元打火機了？

sentences.english: You can organise tea parties in honor of your mother on a Mothers Day。
sentences.chinese: 母親節那天你可以“以母之名”舉辦一場茶話會。

sentences.english: They showed the old lady numerous little attentions at the tea party.
sentences.chinese: 在茶話會上他們對那位老太太百般殷勤。

sentences.english: They have a tea party and astounding resolutions roll past.
sentences.chinese: 他們開着茶話會，天雷提案滾滾來。

sentences.english: You can organise tea parties in honor of your mother on a Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母親節那天你可以“以母之名”舉辦一場茶話會。

sentences.english: You can organise tea of your mother on a Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母親節那天你可以“以母之名”舉行一場茶話會。

sentences.english: Or an old fashioned tea party?
sentences.chinese: 或者來個老式的茶話會。

sentences.english: There is no happy reconciliatory tea party or some such at the end.
sentences.chinese: 沒有快樂協調的茶話會或類似這樣的結尾。

sentences.english: You can organize tea parties in respect of your mom upon the Mothers Day.
sentences.chinese: 母親節那天你可以“以母之名”舉辦一場茶話會。

sentences.english: Each boy and each girl has been invited to the tea-party.
sentences.chinese: 每個男孩和每個女孩都被邀請參加茶話會了。

definition: fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
drinking party/to go on a binge/to paint the town red
Mao Sui recommends himself (idiom); to offer one's services (in the style of Mao Sui offering his services to king of Chu 楚 of the Warring states)
to praise the virtue of sb or sth while concealing their faults
Ruyuan Yao Autonomous County in Shaoguan 韶關|韶关[Shao2 guan1], Guangdong
Yangdong county in Yangjiang 陽江|阳江[Yang2 jiang1], Guangdong
lit. to sleep on brushwood and taste gall (like King Gou Jian of Yue 勾踐|勾践[Gou1 Jian4]), in order to recall one's humiliations) (idiom)/fig. to maintain one's resolve for revenge
